senses.sense_definition: A member of a ten-man commission in ancient Rome, specifically appointed in 451 and 450 BC to write the code of laws known as the Twelve Tables.

examples.text: The appointed <w>decemvir</w> worked tirelessly to codify the new laws for the Roman citizens.
History records that one specific <w>decemvir</w> abused his power, leading to the collapse of the commission.

senses.sense_definition: A member of any ruling body, council, or committee composed of exactly ten people.

examples.text: Each <w>decemvir</w> in the Venetian Council of Ten was sworn to absolute secrecy regarding state matters.
The organization was structured so that no single <w>decemvir</w> could make a unilateral decision without the others.
